Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, ok room size, so-so location, bad service, gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: arabxesque
Reviews.Content: Room size: For a double occupancy, room size was OK. The view: Had a nice Bosphorous view... pretty beautiful, though not worth any increase in price since you can just go to the terrace a few floors up and check out the views. The other side of the hotel is the Blue Mosque (gorgeous) Walls: PAPER THIN. Listened to a neighbor two rooms over have awkwardly loud sex (though I understand this is a hotel). Room keys: They can't provide double occupants with more than one key. This makes things rather awkward. Wifi: Continuously had wifi issues. Price: This place is somewhat overpriced IMHO (though most hotels in Istanbul are). Location: Not horribly off the beaten bath (7-10 minutes walking uphill to get to the Blue Mosque & Haggia Sophia) but not exactly central (I also got lost a number of times returning even though I rarely got lost otherwise in all of Istanbul). Service: While the gentlemen at the front desk were mostly nice... at least one man when we requested an additional item just flat out said NO. Then when questioned again "No?", he just repeated it. No idea what to make of that.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!”
Reviews.Author: osbornestephen
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family and I was so pleased with our time in this lovely hotel. Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, the Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace are within very easy walking distance. Quality upholstery, spacious rooms and high speed connection Wifi was also reliable. Then the open buffet breakfast was one of the best that I have ever eaten in Istanbul. All the staff are so polite and friendly. Do not leave the hotel without enjoying the fasinating view of Bosphorus on the terrace. I very much appreciated this with the service. I would definitely recommend the Antis Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trains not as bad as reported”
Reviews.Author: Whabooks
Reviews.Content: We were on the first floor and the train rumblings only last about 10 seconds so we found them no problem. Breakfast good. Staff very nice. Room a bit small but clean. We were there during Easter break when rooms were very expensive at other hotels. This was a good buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: JULBEV
Reviews.Content: The room we were given was disappointing, but generally good accommodation. Nice bathroom. Warned about the trains, but didn't realise that they came so close to our room it vibrated when one went passed. (We were on the first floor) Breakfast good. Close to all the main sights. Lovely view from the terrace. Staff mostly really helpful. The cobbled uneven street leading to the entrance could be difficult for anyone with walking difficulties - but it wasn't a problem for us, it added to the charm of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: Claire113
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a three-night weekend at the Antis Hotel. The location I cannot fault - very close to all of the main attractions in the Old Town. The rooms were quite small with twin beds rather than double which I find rather irritating when you book a double, but both the bedroom and bathroom were very clean - a powerful shower which I always welcome. We did have to ask to change room after the first night however. The proximity to the train line is well documented in the other reviews, but nobody appears to have been bothered by the AC units placed outside of the windows on one side of the hotel. The noise was unbearable - so much so that my boyfriend said he welcomed the sounds of the passing trains during the night as it momentarily drowned out the AC units! The second room was much better - still noisy due to train line but no AC units. The staff were generally very helpful, but I am still at a loss as to why one member of staff on Reception informed us on Saturday morning that the Grand Bazaar was closed that day and we should go the next day instead. He suggested he book us on a tour of the Bosphorus instead. Being a rather cynical person by nature and suspecting this to be a sales ploy, I didn't believe him so we went and spent a lovely day at the very open Grand Bazaar. Had we believed him and gone the next day (Sunday), we would have found the Bazaar very much closed. Other the this incident, I was impressed with the service at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “City Break Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Objective_Babe
Reviews.Content: An ideal hotel for a city break located in Sultanahamet. Rooms are tidy, modern and welcoming. Wifi connection is good and English speaking TV channels available are good- BBC, CNBC, CNN etc. Breakfast range is okay (standard hot food but no mushrooms nor hash browns were served). There is a train line behind the hotel which does not make it ideal for anyone who wishes to stay in-doors all day. The hotel can arrange shuttle transfer (relatively cheaper) so call them ahead for the service. Basically the hotel is very good for a short-term stay. I stayed for a few days and found that the hotel is about 10 minutes walk to the main Istanbul attractions: Blue Mosque and the Museum, and about twenty minutes walk to the Grand Bazaar. The Tram Station and Sightseeing tour bus terminal is right in front of the Blue Mosque. There is also a mid-size Bazaar by the Blue Mosque. If you like you can pay 2 Turkish Lira (one way) for a tram ride if you want to understand the local town shops around town (kind of like taking a local bus from one end to the other). I ate at nice seafood restaurant call Akbiyik-from Antis hotel take second right to the junction. There is also a guitar chill-out spot a few yards from the resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Main Sites”
Reviews.Author: Adeeb U
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 11. The hotel is within walking distance of the main attractions of Sultanahmet such as the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia. The tram station is also about 10 minutes walk away. The staff were friendly and helpful.The room was small yet clean and comfortable; there is, however, a train line which passes right beside the hotel, and this could affect some light sleepers. I frequently heard this train, though my wife managed to sleep through it fine so it all depends. I understand that it depends on which room you have as well. There are a few extra touches such as free internet access in the lobby which some travellers may find useful.

Reviews.Title: “Antis Hotel is your palace in Ä°stanbul!”
Reviews.Author: GÃ¶khan D
Reviews.Content: First, I want to mention that Antis Hotel is in a place where you can reach many historical and other touristis sites such as the Blue Mosque , Hagia Sophia, TopkapÄ± Palace and Basilica Cistern.Also from terrace, you will never get tired of watching the splendid view of Bosphorus and both Asian and European side.Don't forget to have a cup tea from the terrace if you pass by around the hotel.It was a wonderfl experince for me:) The Hotel provides you a five star hotel quality with specious rooms , comfortable beds and kind service. The Hotel Staf are really sincere to help its quest.. Besides, you can have an enjoyable breakfast from open buffet breakfast service with tradional Turkish cookies and tastes. Last but not least, the private service with luxurious vehicles from the airport to hotel makes you feel previliged. I strongly advise you to spend one night and Ä± assure you will nver regret!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, except if you are a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_Lqt
Reviews.Content: Good location, great service, nice room, excellent bathroom (very clean, good and new shower, clean towels every day), tea and coffee available and very friendly staff. Just one detail:our room was located next to a railroad...not as in "in the proximity of" but really NEXT to a railroad,you could almost touch the trains (that passed every 5 minutes from dusk till dawn). We had booked a non-refundable room, so maybe that was why we were allocated to the one we had. The windows have double glazing so they do filter out some of the noise and the trains don't ride between midnight and 5am. But if you can, try to book a room at the other side of the hotel (facing the street), this should be much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy your Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: Charming staff, excellent breakfast, clean and well serviced rooms and a great location (trains are really not an issue). We thougherly enjoyed our 7 night stay including the advice from the desk and local trips organised by Walkabout tours. Good value for money an excellent choice. Christine and Mike, London.

Reviews.Title: “Sincere service”
Reviews.Author: ddhull
Reviews.Content: Though we had a bad start when the hotel did not remember to pick us up at the airport despite a confirming e-mail, the front desk men made amends by providing us with exceptional service from then on for the length of our stay. The hotel is well situated in the old town, the room is comfortable, the lobby and roof veranda are lovely and breakfast is very good, It is true, we were next to a fast local train track but we quickly learned to sleep through it and it was definitely not a problem ... just a bit of a surprise the first time a train passed. We did, however, have a view of the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, steep and difficult location”
Reviews.Author: Estelle L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff friendly breakfast acceptable, the only problem is the steep and difficult location the entry is dangerous for guests with mobility problems

Reviews.Title: “wunderful”
Reviews.Author: klaus75Berlin
Reviews.Content: We have been for 9 days in Istanbul/Antis-Hotel. The service was high class, especially the room service. The place is very near to the Blue Mosqie as well as to the Hagia Sophia. The personal is very helpful in all situations. We are sure this hotel is very good managed and an ideal hotel for a trip to Istanbul. It seems weÂ´ll come back next year. Especially IÂ´ll mention the Mr. Okan, Ilhan and Senol. Not so often one will find such friendly and helpful people. All the best for them and the hotel - fam. Zell

Reviews.Title: “what can I say but great!!!”
Reviews.Author: mo a
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on recommendation from my niece and nephew who stayed there in July 2011, my wife and I were not disappointed!! This was a belated 25th anniversary present for my wife and our stay at the hotel made it a trip to remember. Staff were extremely friendly and very helpful, both Ercan and Orcan who manage the reception cannot be praised enough for ensuring that our stay at the antis always remains unforgettable. The first day we got there we were told that not wanting to spoil our holiday due to only a small room being available they asked us to transfer to another hotel for the first night only and a more suitable room would be prepared for us the following day, I suspect this was more to do with a double booking rather than the reason cited, however not to be undone we accepted on the premise as stated. The hotel arranged was a quaint boutique hotel which again didn't disappoint. Both Orcan and Ercan were true to their word as the following day we returned to the antis as booked and a more suitable room is an understatement, to our surprise we were given the deluxe suite on the roof - grrreat. Complimentary wifi accessed from the in room computer, ensuite jacuzzi bathroom, TV, wopping kingsize bed and a great sea view. Buffet breakfast with a reasonable choice of fruits, nuts, yoghurt, hot food, (boiled eggs, scrabmled eggs) breads and cereals with coffee and juices was more than sufficient to sustain us for the site seeing ahead. The view from the terrace accessed from walking out from our room cannot be beaten, the sea on one side and the blue mosque on the other!! Apart from the hotel itself the key aspect is its perfect location, just 5 mins walk to all the main sites of Istanbul, Blue mosque, Aya sofia, Topkapi palace etc, cannot be beaten. I know many visitors make reference to the train tracks directly behind the hotel, but believe me this is a minor distraction as the views from the terrace, the location and the satff more than make up for this especially if you are looking to take full advantage of your time in istanbul to see the sites. My thanks to all the staff and Mr sirdar Gemal the manager for making our stay the perfect holiday and leaving a lasting memory of Istanbul that will always be just that unforgettable. We are already planning our return and this time with our children.atintas pleasant and memorable. P.S Ercan Riad says Hello and good luck with your national service.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid to avoid disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Tajmeister
Reviews.Content: 1) I paid via lastminute an extra Â£200 for a supreme deluxe with sea view - the room that we received was neither supreme nor with a sea view - we got 2 single beds stuck together - simply unacceptable. What was worse was that when they showed us this room, they had the single beds hidden - we only found this out w later that night - after which, they insisted we had accepted that room - we were on a honeymoon. 2) lastminute cannot help greatly with this hotel as they act as "sales agents". So be careful - no protection here. 3) What makes this hotel particularly bad is that they did not admit that they failed to provide the facilities that were paid for - without this, it was impossible to enter into a dialogue to improve the situation. For those who may not be familiar with Turkey, there was no language barrier. They simply found it easier to hide behind their perfectly competent grasp of english. 4) When asked via lastminute about this issue - they said a) that they had showed us multiple rooms (this is true, the other room they showed us was a standard double, which did not fit the bill either) and b) they did not take the money for the sea view room - true, we paid via lastminute - they simply avoided answering the questions put to them. The decor of the hotel is good - but the service simply does not match their prices - only book the basic room here as they do not appear to have the facility to book out upgraded services nor are their staff competent at dealing with any issues that may arise on the ground. How they could not resolve this issue when we stayed 8 nights is beyond me! This is 4* turkish style!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: 2011clive
Reviews.Content: We booked this for a city break to Istanbul. Whilst reasonably priced, it is advertised as four star. On arrival, the staff were surly and unhelpful with the exception of the doorman. Our room was small and basic, and worse, the toilet hadn't been cleaned properly after the previous guests. The roof terrace and bar were nice, with good views over the sea to the south and to the blue mosque to the north. We were worried about being woken by the 4am call to prayer, but it's much quieter at night so this wasn't a problem. What was a problem however was the railway right next to the hotel, with frequent trains from 5am until midnight. The breakfast was of poor standard, with dry bread and watered down juice. Proper coffee and fruit juice are available... at extra charge. When checking out, the staff were again very rude and refused to let us leave until the mini bar had been checked by housekeeping. We didn't expect ultimate luxury, but friendly staff, and a clean room were our minimum expectations, and the Antis failed to deliver. Let down an otherwise fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: smg464
Reviews.Content: Last week we spent 3 nights in hotel Antis and agreed to be mooved to a neghboring hotel Almina for the 4th night. First, someone from the hotel should have been waiting for us at the airport for a free transport (4nigts stay), but noone came..Only later when we phoned and asked from an office of Rent a car, a guy finely came to pick us up, noone ever apologise for that. Unpleasant receptionist gave us (like) a better room , althouht we already booked Deluxe room through their website and mr Serdar Gider, the manager. Room nothing like on the picture, very small, no balconies as I asked for, they only have franch windows.. Anyway, very small, noisy from the street itself, let alone train behind the bilding that wakes you up from 5am! Every 15 minutes approx! For breakfast it was very poor and not so fresh, we asked for fried aggs, and apple tea, we got it, but the waiter came later with a receipt, saying it's extra..Only when I got angry and said that we are already paying 110Euros for a night (and buffet breakfast) and we spoke to mr Gider they gave up of charging us.. When we were leaving for hotel Almina (dont go there as well), the receptionist tried to charge us for 5 instead for 4 nights! Only good thing about hotel is location, therace on the top is good but very windy.. But there are 100 hotels arround and choose carefully! And trust me, I have seen so many hotels as I am a Trevel Guide, but this was one of my bigest mistakes choosing this hotel. This is 2 star hotel charging you 4/5 star price!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: CarolDo
Reviews.Content: Views from the roof terrace alone is a good enough reason to book this hotel, although this was not the reason why we had booked this hotel. This was our very first visit to Istanbul and in general to Turkey. The location of the Hotel could not have been better as it is located very central and close to the main attractions. During our seven night stay we have been treated extremely well, our rooms have been cleaned to our satisfaction and the breakfast was very good. Overall we can say it is a safe and friendly, clean Hotel. We would like to mention Ercan, who works at the reception. He is exceptionally helpful and very friendly with a great deal of knowledge of the surrounding area. He is no doubt an essential to every visitor to the area. We did arrange the transfer from the airport to this hotel via a website called www.thisisturkey.net , which we also booked two excursions with them and paid a small amount of deposit prior to the booking and the rest of the remaining balance was paid on the day when they picked us up. Excellent service. I have to emphasize here, if you do want to see the Istanbul from a wider view with more insight in to it then you must book excursions. It is a huge city and simply can not be seen only by visiting its few neighbourhoods We took every advice into our heads with regards to the warnings on the website I mentioned above. At nights we mainly visited some restaurants and bars in the neighbourhood which Ercan the tour guide and the receptionist of the hotel recommended us, which we were not dissapointed . Also Ercan arranged for us a booking to Whirling Dervishes which we found this show very interesting. However the highlight of our evenings was the Turkish Night, again Ercan did the leg work for us. Would we go back to the same hotel if we did re-visited Istanbul , well, if we don't win the lottery, yes.

Reviews.Title: “do NOT trust Hotel Antis BOOKINGS”
Reviews.Author: D C
Reviews.Content: This Hotel provided us with good rooms and facilities on our first 3 nights. it is within walking distance of main sights. BUT on returning to the hotel after a tour of other Turkish sites, having already paid up for another 2 nights , we were told that they HAD NO ROOMS FOR US. The family had to be put up in 2 separate hotels. While in the lobby another 9 Couples told us they had the same experience the day before. It sems that being told they have NO Room for you , although you have booked and paid, happens often as the management accept overbookings. The staff are understanding and apologetic but the manager is not. For him it is acceptable that people are put in another hotel. It took us 3 hours to get rooms in 2 separate hotels, from 10 pm to 1am. That is what one expects from Antis Hotel. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelfishgirl
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Istanbul and I chose Antis hotel based on past reviews on trip advisor. I would highly recommend this hotel if it is your first time to the city because it is so close to all the tourist attrations and saved me on taking taxis. The area is safe and full of food options and shops. The only complaint I would have is the beds, they were hard and not comfortable. Overall it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shah186402
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel to stay at. Very friendly guys on receptions who are always willing to help at all times. Hotel is clean, terrace has fantasic view of the blue mosque and the sea. Breakfast is lovely too!. Highly recommended to stay at the hotel. Close to all sites so 'in a nut shell' value for money. Shah(shaka)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liesbeth_V
Reviews.Content: The Antis Hotel is a very good hotel in the historical centre of Istanbul. The staff is really friendly, the rooms are very nice and the breakfast is really good too! We had a quiet room, so we had no noise of the passing tram. The hotel has a great terrace with a beautiful view. I would go again! My boyfriend and I had a really nice stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Heart of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: rabbit7311
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within walking distance from major attractions such as the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque. The tram line is also wÄ±thin 400m. The roof top terrace is a nice place to have a drink after a day of sight seeing wÄ±th views of the Blue Mosque and sea. However, don't expect food ( maybe some small snacks) as it isn't a restaurant, and a beer will cost you 4 Euros (10.33 TL), where as outside at a pub or restaurant it costs 4 to 5 TL. A really annoying habit is that hotels in Istanbul often price in Euros not TL. There are many reaturants to choose from around the area serving mostly the same traditional Turkish cusine, most restaurants have terraces or roof top seating. The rooms were both clean and comfortable and well stocked wÄ±th mini bar, bath soaps, shampoo, safe ect. My favourite was the shower being it had strong water pressure. The beds were clean, comfortable, yet slightly hard as they are in this part of the world. Furthermore, I personally loved hearing the call to prayer throughout the day. It really added to the experience along wÄ±th having such great views. The train does pass and can cause some disturbance, but I hardly noticed it as the windows are doubled glazed, you can feel and hear it at times, but this depends on your location in the hotel. The train stops between 2400 and 0600. The front desk is stocked wÄ±th attraction pamplets and maps; staff is more than willing to offer advice and give suggestions. Inaddition, they offer an airport transfer service to the hotel, free for guests staying 3 days or more, or if less, it can be arranged for 25 Euros. A taxi wÄ±ll cost you 35 TL (15 Euros). The breakfast in my opinion was ok, nothing special, a bit dull if anything. However, that said, I looked at other hotels around the area and they provided the same style of breakfast ( nothing special). If location is a priority and being comfortable for value appeals to you. I than would suggest the Antis. If you're a light sleeper, perhaps you should look elsewhere. However, Istanbul is a noisy cÄ±ty and this area has little traffic and is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great City and Lovely People. Here are some tips.”
Reviews.Author: bazriad
Reviews.Content: Antis Hotel was definitely a very nice place to stay, the guys at the reception and all other staff were very very helpful and friendly. Loads of advice was given to us about attractions and things to watch out for. I would speak to Ercan or Okan who usually sit at reception and speak very good english and are very helpful for any questions you may have. The hotel was a tad difficult to find when we first got there but once we found it, it was such a perfect location. It lies right next to the Arasta Bazaar, so if your visiting Istanbul for the first time and are not sure where to go and how to get there this is what you need to do. If travelling from Sabiha airport or Ataturk airport you need to get a coah/bus or taxi to Taksim square. We travelled from Sabiha which is further from Sultanahmet and got a coach/bus from outside the airport for 12 Lira each to Taksim square. At Taksim square we queued up at a little box where they sell a bus card called a Akbil card, it cost 5 Lira per person and you can get a bus "61 B" from Taksim to Sultanahmet or ask the man who sells the tickets for X amount of tickets to sultanahmet and which bus to take. Make sure to ask the driver to let you know when you get to SultanAhmet. When you get to Sultanahmet you need to identify the tram tracks in the middle of the road and follow it down the hill you should see McDonalds on the right and after McDonalds there is a restaurant on the Corner Called "Baran". Keep on the same side of the road as the restaurant and walk down past the tram stop. There is a mosque on the right after the tram stop and if you take a little right from the mosque you will see an area where there are wooden benches to sit if you cary on walking you will come to a small fountain which has stairs next to it with water flowing down on the side of the stairs. After the stairs there is an open area and you should see to your right the tall obelisk but dont walk towards the obelisk instead keep walking to the left towards another fountain which is further up on the left. To the right of the fountain you will see a lot of wooden benches from where you can see the famous blue mosque on your right. Next to these benches you will see green areas and an italian garden sort of thing which has benches and creeper plants on your right. behind this garden to the back of the mosque there is the ARASTA bazaar. Ask the locals and they will know where you have to go. Walk down the stairs and take a left and walk through. On the left is a big open cafe/restaurant and on the right is a small shop where you can buy drinks/food etc. After this there is a road, cross over and continue to walk down till the next road and take a right. Keep walking to the end of the street till you see a little corner shop at the end on the left. If you look up you will see Antis Hotel infront on your right. So sorry for the long winded explanation but we walked for over an hour an a half till we found it and thought it might be useful if we direct you there before you get there. Definitely take the Bosphorous Cruise which costs about 70-80 Lira per person. Ask the local shops and they should be able to sort it out for you. We recommend the afternoon cruise as you will get plenty of sun and a lot to see. It lasts 5 hours. Eat loads before or take snacks. Also book a shuttle transfer from the local shops to the airport on departure which is much more comfortable and stress free, it costs about 25-30 Lira per person and can pick you up from either your hotel or the shop next to it. I hope this is sufficient. Beware that although Antis is 4* on most websites do not compare it to UK/US 4*. I think it was great as we only really slept there but the beds were very comfortable and cleaned every day. Irons are available, A/C, safe deposit box and Powershowers which are Grrrreat. Make sure to spend time on the roof terrace on the 4th floor as it has great views of the Bosphorous sea and the Blue Mosque. Apart from that everything is right there next to the Hotel. go to the Grand Bazaar and Haggle. And I means loads. We paid 70% Less than asking price on most items so make sure you try and get the best deal. Also check out the Apple tea at the local restaurants or street vendors - its great! Get prices for cetain items from shops before buying at the grand bazaar as some items are actually cheaper in the shops. Big bottles of water are 1 Lira and small bottles are half Lira!!! Cheap! But buy water from shops not street vendors etc. The Hotel is near a train line so request a room further away from the track, although there are no trains at night and early morning you wont notice them much, We requested a room on the other side of the hotel and the next day we got one. Thats all for now. Go to Istanbul and enjoy! Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Good modern relatively spacious hotel for the price, must like trains!”
Reviews.Author: Mobius1
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a 4 nights stay via a well known web booking site - Super Deluxe room and flights with BA to the much more central Ataturk Airport and room for Â£350 per person. As the flights (if booked alone) cost nearly that per person it seemed like a good deal! I arranged the free airport transfer by email and the Hotel Antis reception team were very responsive and indeed there was a driver waiting for us (and 2 other guests on same flight) despite a delay getting though visa and passports (2 separate queues!). On arrival we were warmly greeted by Okan (Gohkan) the hotel manager and his staff. Turkish tea was served. When taken to our room though I was dismayed to see it seemed to be a standard twin room on the second floor. When I politely challenged Okan that I had paid extra for a 'super deluxe double room' he said that one was not available but he could put us in a better room the next day. He also moved us to a slightly larger double room on the second floor that day. The standard rooms do seem to be perfectly nice though and bigger than your average Istanbul old city hotel room. The next morning (after a nice breakfast by Turkish hotel standards - good bread and coffee) Okan stuck to his word and moved us to the top (and only) suite on the 4th floor which opens out to the roof terrace. This was a very nice spacious room with great views over the sea. We had a free to use PC in our room and there is one in the lobby as well. We were able to check in for our return leg and Okan kindly printed the boarding passes for us. The roof terrace is very nice and tidy although staff are not often up there but you can easily arrange to have drinks or breakfast brought up (polite to give tip of course). The staff in general were very friendly and Okan especially was most helpful despite the initial booking issue. Now the big issue some people have had is with the TRAINS. Even on the top floor you cannot escape them. They ran with differing frequency (roughly every 10 minutes, longer in evenings) and some were quite quiet and others louder! We actually found the noise perfectly tolerable and even meditative and the other bonus is that when there are no trains it is very quiet with no cars honking horns or rumbling past on the cobbled streets (although the area around the hotels not nearly as busy as other areas of Sultanhamet). If worried, I would insist on a room WITHOUT a sea view as in that way your room will be facing the city side with a small street in front but with no view. The hotel is well placed on the edge of the busier old town area but still within easy 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagias Sofia. We also walked to the remains of the impressive aqueduct and the SÃ¼leymaniye Mosque (better inside than the Blue Mosque we thought) and down to Eminonou to get ferries to the Asian side and up the Bosporus. The tram (1.75TL) was also useful for getting back when our legs had given out. Okan gave a good tip, get the tram to last stop on the line and then the fenicluar up to Taksim square. Then you can take a longish leisurely walk back via the Gelata tower and bridge -seeing the more modern 'normal' Beyoglu area of Istanbul on the way. All food whether street stall or restaurant was excellent, I personally would recommend the Yumer and Dulmer ( I think) more unusual type kebabs when grabbing a quick lunch on foot or of course the famous fried fish and bread widely available near the ferries. Would also recommend getting some Mehanes (Turkish Meze) in one of the places on Nevizade Street near Taksim square. We also had several excellent meals in the many nearby restaurants but our favourite (for the view alone) was the Seven Hills roof terrace restaurant. The food was a little pricy for what you got but the views of the Blue Mosque and Hagias Sofia nearby by twilight were simply unforgettable in the warm evening air! I would also recommend for any blokes getting a Turkish shave at the many barbers for 10TL, meticulously done plus ear hairs waxed or burnt away! We also had a Turkish bath and massage at the ancient Gedikpasa hamam which was arranged by the hotel reception for 55TL per person with free car transfer. This was a good price and it is one of the most authentic baths in town, built in 1457. I was the only non local in the menâ€™s section and it was like something from Midnight Express but all the more an experience for it! All in all, we thought the hotel was good and had a fantastic break although Istanbul is certainly not a place to relax, too much to see!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would go again.”
Reviews.Author: Chopandbird
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. We stayed bed and breakfast. Breakfast was lovely, options for omelets and other things, at extra cost of about 3 euros, and is served till 10.30 for those who like a bit longer in bed. Staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms very good, nice modern bathrooms, powerful shower which I love. Nice comfy beds. We were in room 305 which didn't have the best view but you do only sleep there. Great location, with lots of nice places to eat near by. I recommend oceans 7. Easy access from sabiha gokcen airport by bus, ferry then tram. Although it will take a couple of hours, you get a great view and experience of this beautiful city for 7 lira.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, good price”
Reviews.Author: JJdR
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very pleasant, the staff was helpfull and friendly. The room was nice, the hotel easy to reach and close to all major landmaks. The only negative the train coming by every our or so.

Reviews.Title: “Average - certainly not de-luxe”
Reviews.Author: rudders064
Reviews.Content: having booked a de-luxe room we were very disappointed as our tiny room (no 306) was directly over the railway line and very noisey. We also had the a/c units for 5 other rooms on the outside wall so the noise was pretty constant. When we asked the staff what time the trains stopped running we were told 11pm - clearly untrue as they ran throughout the night! Hotel was clean, well located and breakfast OK - but no way was room 306 of de-luxe standard and we consequently felt we didnt get value for money. Gavin on reception not particularily helpful when we questioned standard of room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location of the Tourist Sites”
Reviews.Author: W0rldtrek
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel from Travelocity. After reserving, I asked the hotel to provide an airport transfer, and it went without a hitch. The room was on the third floor and was clean, pleasantly decorated and had a nice view of the Sea of Maramara. The train tracks were next to the hotel and the neighborhood mosque had a minaret that blasted the call to prayer several times a day. Normally one might consider this an issue, but we had no problem with this. After all, we were in Europe/Middle East, and these issues should be expected. The view and the location exceeded our expectation and overshadowed any downsides. There are plenty of great places to eat in the area. There is a great convenience store across the street to buy water (1 TL), soda, and snacks. Up the hill and around the corner were the Blue Mosque an Hagia Sofia. This made getting a taxi easy, and when we needed to return, we just told them to drop us off by the Blue Mosque. The area is hilly and the hotel is near the bottom of the hill. So there was plenty of uphill walking, but you get your exercise. The roof top of the hotel has a terrace that has a great view of the Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus. There is an area that is enclosed with a tent structure to shelter you from wind and sun. If you want a drink, there is a bar, but you need to warn the front desk, so they will visit the roof on occasion to help you, The staff was hospital and courteous. They were always willing to help us with our needs. The breakfast was good, and a typical buffet of vegetables, cheese, breads, and cereals. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Simmygugli
Reviews.Content: the hotel staff is present, polite, and very prepared. They can advise guests on the best way. Very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Tourist class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shen_Jackson
Reviews.Content: They were overbooked the first night that we arrived, so they sent us to a crappy hotel for one night even though I had a confirmed room. They paid for a cruise of the Bosphorous to make up for it, but I was annoyed enough to knock off 1 point. The location is great, short walk to Blue Mosque, etc. It is right next to a train line, so please keep your windows closed. Also, the breakfast isn't great.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming hotel, well-placed for most major sights”
Reviews.Author: chumpsteak
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I have just returned from several enjoyable days spent at the Antis Hotel. Having primarily chosen to stay here due to its proximity to the main tourist sights, throughout the course of our stay we felt lucky to be staying at such a friendly hotel. From the moment were checked in by the very knowledgable Gavin, we were given a great overview of the sights all over the city both nearby and further afield. This information extended to day trips available within Istanbul and also outside the city, and also suggestions for evening entertainment and places to eat. The room itself (a twin) was a decent size, with fresh dÃ©cor and good en suite facilities. The beds were very comfortable and the room was equipped with a safe, TV and tea-making facilities. Free wi-fi is available in the rooms and throughout the hotel, Gavin just gave us the access code after we checked in. We were aware of trains passing by every so often, but not to the point where it kept us awake or bothered us at all since we were on the opposite side of the hotel. If we had been in a room closer to the train track it may have been more of an issue. Breakfast provided a good range of options: cold meats, cheeses, breads and pancakes as well as hot items such as scrambled or boiled eggs, sausage and potatoes. All of this was included in the room rate but there were additional items available to order on demand at a small cost. Although the weather was too cold when we visited to really spend a lot of time up on the roof, there is a lovely terrace there with either sea views to the south or to the Blue Mosque to the north. Well worth going up there at night to get a great picture of the Mosque all lit up! All in all we had an enjoyable stay and were glad that we chose Antis Hotel. We were especially pleased that the hotel left 2 little Easter eggs in our room to say thank you towards the end of our stay...nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel downtown in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: monimischu
Reviews.Content: Very central for exploring the town. The view either hand to Bosporus and the other hand to the Blue Moschee is fantastic. Perfect airport transfer, good room service, well equipped rooms, good trained, friendly service team. Good introduction of highlights of the town at time of check in. A lot of restaurants surround the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “freindly staff, funny, welcomming and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: zia_11
Reviews.Content: upon arrival the receptionist said they had overbooked, we were very dissapointed. This seems to be a reoccuring theme. But i would not be too disappointed because they carried our luggage and we walked two minutes up the charming old city roads to hotel Almino which is more expensive and has better quality of rooms then Antis!!! The next day we were offered the delux room with wonderful sea view from the bed. breakfast is not offered at the roof top dining area but some people did take it up there. The view is spectacular, look left and you see the bosphorous look right and you see the magnificent Blue mosque without any obstructions!! Quality of rooms is good enough, not five star but clean, the power shower is excellent. I was not too keen on their breakfast, its mainly cold stuff, slices of cheese, chicken on fresh bread. luke warm scrambled eggs. The reception staff were very helpful, gave us good tips on where to go for good food. how much to pay for taxi's and what to avoid. They made our city break very warm, welcoming and enjoyable. Location is brilliant! lots of little local shops around to get essentials. The train didn't bother me cos i'm a heavy sleeper, probably cos we fit so much in during the day and so tired when we got home. Thats the way to go!!

Reviews.Title: “Total disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JBest-Shala
Reviews.Content: After searching for the perfect 5 day stay for our honeymoon. My new husband and I picked the Antis Hotel. We were greeted by lovely staff after our 25 Euro transfer from the airport (later finding out average price is 5 Euro) We were taken to our Deluxe Room with Sea View (481 Euro for 5 nights) We could not see the Sea, we saw a burned up building and railroad tracks. They were told a month in advance that it was our honeymoon but did nothing to make it special for us or decorate. We paid 24 Euro for a few sodas from the mini bar and the toilet paper holding kept coming off the wall. The shower leaked and water was always on the floor, but yet the bed was comfortable. They advertised a "sound proof" room which we later found out was not. We heard talking downstairs, knocking on other doors and of course the lovely train that went by and shook the walls every 20 min. There was no room service menu, we had to call downstairs to have one brought to our room, and no tissue, it was a nightmare. The breakfast was cheap food and when we arrived we had to wait 6 hours for our room because people were still sleeping in it. We were told to take a tour bus around the city for 25 Euro, but were told afterwards that it was 25 Euro EACH. Our honeymoon suffered and we had to pay an 85 Euro cancellation fee to check out 3 days early.

Reviews.Title: “great place in the middle of everything regarding history”
Reviews.Author: drshaker
Reviews.Content: great people, very helpfull, rooms very clean but little small if u r an indoor people turkey very safe at night in this district lots of shops music on the street but oriental not the western style the food was quite enough the chefs are very pleasent people very friendly staff they know everything on the map and how to get there and the three musketeers as i used to call them me and my family Gokhan , Aukhan and ergan are really wonderfull people and they were really the reason we had a very pleasant 14 days on the anadols. one would like to take them as peer models for the honest hard working young men, the only problem was the train but is stops from 12 am to 6 am beds are comfy and the only problem with the room was the TV only in turkish.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: bushies27
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Antik hotel was legit. The best thing going for this hotel is its location, which isn't to put down other accommodations the hotel offers, including good service (one of the guys at the reception, Gavin, is particularly amicable and will chat with you about anything or offer advice), a nice Turkish breakfast and internet access in the lobby. But being right near the Sultan Ahmet area is a godsend for those looking to explore some of Istanbul's brightest attractions without resorting to public transportation. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: umarbin786
Reviews.Content: Antis Hotel was a very good accommodation, the staff at Antis hotel were very helpful and funny. they understand everyone and treat them like proper guest.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean hotel with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: prevj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Antis for a week. The room was not large but perfectly adequate since we were out all day. It was comfortable, clean and well maintained. The staff are are chirpy and helpful. It is close to a fairly busy railway route which didn't trouble us at all though it might disturb others. Breakfast is excellent and the waiter service attentive. We found it to be an excellent base for a week's visit and the surrounding area is also interesting.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a curate's egg”
Reviews.Author: fromliverpool
Reviews.Content: First off, the taxi driver had tremendous difficulty finding the hotel, despite us having booked the taxi from the airport directly with the hotel. The receptionist was all smiles and friendly and offered us a free beer. We then found out that this was to soften us up for what came next - there was a problem with the booking and we would need to stay the first night at the "sister hotel". For some reason, I had checked the website the week before travelling and noticed that the Antis had rooms on offer for double the price we had paid so we refused and were shown to our rooms at the Antis. The receptionist was never quite so friendly after that. We heard a similar line been given to others during our stay, but never did find out where this other hotel was. The location was very good, but a bit noisy due to overlooking the railway line. Double glazing and air-con helped block this out but not completely. The rooms were small but clean, comfortable and smart. However, the walls are thin and there was quite lot of noise from next door rooms. We had breakfast on the roof, although it is not served there (despite the impression given on the website) - something to do with a licensing problem allegedly. Staff were very helpful in assisting us to carry our breakfasts up to the roof. So - good location, nice room, but not for the light sleeper and we didn't feel we could trust the management of this hotel. Istanbul is great, will visit again, but maybe a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict12321
Reviews.Content: From the time we walked into the door we were greeted with such friendly staff and their knowledge (and humor) were really refreshing and helpful. Ercan Bildik (front desk clerk) was able to give us a great overview of the city, the transportation, tops sites to see and great restaurants to visit. The location couldn't have been better. It was very close to the top sites but enough out of the way that we weren't in the middle of everything. It was clean, spacious and a great price! We had the best time in Istanbul and would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to visit Istanbul. Thanks to the wonderful staff! You really made our trip memorable and the hotel was really a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Go Again”
Reviews.Author: SarahF07
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, ideal location(walking distance to the Blue Mosque and City Centre), Staff very friendly and helpful. Could not do more for us all. Food good, rooms and hotel lovely. Ercan on reception very friendly, funny and helpful. Planning our next trip already and will most certainly recommend to friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff with nice rooms, shame!”
Reviews.Author: modernexploring
Reviews.Content: I visited the Antis Hotel with my two friends for 5 nights, despite the room being much better than we had expected (despite the room being beside a railway line which we already knew from reading other reviews) the quality of service needs to be seriously improved. Upon arriving at the Hotel at 2pm we were greeted by a rude receptionist who made it out to be a problem that I (a female) was sharing the room we had booked with my two male friends. Understably, with the area we were in surrounding mosques and religious places it would be fair to see why this could be frowned upon but the hotel should not be accepting the booking for a 3 bed triple if they're going to be rude about it. We were made to feel uncomfortable and extremely unwelcome. Once we were shown to our room after 20 minutes of waiting we found there was no 3rd bed in the room, we went to reception and they said they would put one in later so we headed out to dinner and came back at about 10:30pm, naturally expecting the bed to be there - it wasn't. We asked again, and were told it would be brought up in an hour as it was heavy (although they have a lift?!). True to their word, we got a bed after an hour but we were not given a duvet for another hour (which had no cover) and then at about half 2 in the morning a rude member of staff nearly knocked down the door with thumping trying to give us our bed sheets?! Despite this, we enjoyed the buffet breakfast provided every morning which was fresh and delicious with attentive waiting staff. However, another blow to add to an unfortunate start was when it came to us checking out. My friend and I were waiting at reception to get our bags when the housekeeping team came down and were insulting us in Turkish (Not realizing my friend could speak Turkish) saying "Oh there's those weird people in that room with the three beds", "they leave everything all over the room it's disgusting" etc. Not only was it embarrassing and rude to myself and my friends but had other guests heard, it's not only unprofessional but offers even further embarrassment to our group. My Turkish speaking friend spoke to the receptionist and complained, to which we got no apology and a snobby stare. Gorgeous room, lovely breakfast, rude and unprofessional staff all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location, great off-peak deals, would go again!”
Reviews.Author: BalkanG
Reviews.Content: I booked through lastminute and didn't really have any big expectations. My partner is Turkish and we just wanted a centrally located hotel so that she could show me around her city. We wanted a double room but for the first night we got a twin - this room was fine but the sleeping arrangements were not ideal. The next morning we pointed this out to reception and they did everything they could to upgrade us to a fantastic double room in the end for our final 2 nights. The hotel is very reasonable, breakfast is fine and you can find great deals here is you look, such as a free transfer from Ataturk airport. Finally, the location is great, very near Blue Mosque etc and a good selection of bars cafes and even little corner shops. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, great shower”
Reviews.Author: BoroughLad
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 days at the Antis. Modern, clean and good value. Was travelling solo and really enjoyed the stay here. Good location for someone on a city break, close to the main cultural sights, and in the tourist area. Good size standard room. *Really* good shower. Great views from the roof terrace. There's a bar and restaurant up there which must be great in Summer. Friendly team on the door & reception. Happy to chat and help with cabs, tours etc. Yes, there is a local train track behind, but it didn't disturb me, - i even overslept a couple of mornings. Summary: Good value for money, ideal for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “One more hotel.Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Xavi77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located , near St Sofia and the Blue Mosque.The rooms are clean, but some of them are a little bit noisy and small.The train is really close to the hotel.You can see the trains tracks from the window of some rooms. The staff is polite, but no much more.(anyway, do not need more) From my point of view the only negative sentence i would say here is that the breakfast is really poor.Few dishes to choose.

Reviews.Title: “when good, very very good - when bad, horrid!”
Reviews.Author: 2ruse
Reviews.Content: we booked 2 stays at the Antis Hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor - most were glowing and we dismissed the few bad ones as the inevitable few cranks' - but there are times when people are right to be cranky! we arrived very late at night at Istanbul Airport, after 2 long flights from San Francisco, and were very much looking forward to being picked up by the hotel's driver - who wasn't there! a hotel booking desk at the airport called Antis, only to be told that they had cancelled our bookings in error - fortunately they did have a room (probably the worst one in the hotel, but at that point we were happy to have a place to get a little sleep) that night, and then moved us to the correct room (we paid extra for the deluxe sea view, and it looks like that's the way to go - fantastic views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara) the next day - they did seem to think it was very funny that they had messed up imagine then our fury when we returned to the hotel after a week in Cappadocia and on the beautiful Lycian Coast, to once again find no driver despite many confirmations! this turned out to be a miscommunication, and after an hour we did connect with the driver as other reviewers have mentioned, there does seem to be a systemic problem with bookings - we saw one poor woman pleading with the desk when it appeared they had screwed up her reservation as well - if Antis can manage to straighten out the issue with overbooking (i.e. not doing it) and cancelling when they're not meant to, the hotel has a lot to offer: very good location - I had been in Istanbul in 2009, and wanted to be again in the Sultanahmet area close to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, the tram, and other interesting places like the wonderful Cagaloglu hamam - it is indeed very touristy, but there's good reasons for that internet access in the lobby - only while standing up, so nobody can monopolize the computer for too long good Turkish (i.e. lots of food) breakfast with a really hard-working nice waiter the noise from the trains didn't bug us too much, but we were on the other side of the hotel and are both former New Yorkers, so train noise is like white noise to us - the calls to prayer can wake you up too early so I'd recommend ear plugs last year I stayed at the Naz Wooden House Inn around the corner - and although more basic and much smaller (only 7 rooms), I would probably tell friends to stay there - but if not available, the Antis might be fine (as long as they don't mess up your reservation)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service for the entire staff”
Reviews.Author: maggieedwards
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay ay the Antis Hotel. the customer service went far above even the usual Turkish hospitality. From Okan and Ercan at the Front Desk to Gorhan(sp) in both the Lobby and rooftop lounge, I was made to feel very welcome. The rooms are typically European size but the appointments are very good. The location is within walking distance to all major tourist sights, Ayasofia, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. There is also a good smaller bazaar close by which unlike the Grand Bazaar is open on Sunday and great shops one street over. The Front Desk staff is well versed in Engklish and I would recommend this hotel to travellers both new and experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, perfect location and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Alina26_10
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Istanbul. 6 nights we spend in Antis Hotel. Our group ( 8 persons) spent nice time in wonderfull city and we all are realy glad to choose the right hotel.Antis hotel is in very heart of old town of Istanbul, its short walk to all important sights. But the most important - staff. All are friendly and ready to help if You need something. At first, my best regards to Mr. Serdar, manager of the hotel, who cares of our pleasant stay, best regards to Mr. Erean Deniz, who was our best friend whan we were spending the time on the top terrace :) and of course to all receptionists who have enough pation to answer to all our questions :). As I mantioned before the hotel has great location, big and clean rooms and realy kind and friendly staff. I can recommend this hotel for all who have plans to come to Istanbul and still thinking where to stay. There is no discuss in this case, You should stay in best hotel of Istanbul, in Antis hotel. With best regards.... Alina

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ATE_O8
Reviews.Content: It Ä±s sÄ±tuated Ä±n a good regÄ±onÅŸ besÄ±des AghÄ±a SofÄ±a and Sultan Ahmed Mosque.The people of the hotel are frÄ±endly and helpful.Breakfast was delecÄ±ous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: MALKYPOO
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Excellent breakfast buffet. Room clean & comfortable. Staff, Okan,Ercan,Gokhan, helpful, friendly and ready to please. Airport transfer smooth. Definitely stay in Sultanahmet area. Close to historical sites, restaurants, shopping. Sorry guys if I spelled your names wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: GIGJ
Reviews.Content: I question the authenticity of some of the positive reviews for this hotel, particularly any that say it's quiet. It's right next to a railway line and the trains thunder through all through the day. Fortunately they pack up about 12 am but start again in the early hours. The rooms are small and pokey and the staff are cocky and unhelpful. The one positive is it is near the main attractions such as the blue mosque, but so are a lot of other hotels. I would recommend staying in one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Aida3
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and nice hotel well decorated in center of Blue Mosque .Foods are very nice and close to major attraction and also staff are very friendly and helpful specially reception Gavin and Okan definitely we'll come back on Mrach with my children

Reviews.Title: “The staff is deceitful and next to a train”
Reviews.Author: QuecheeII
Reviews.Content: The staff was very pushy and rude, The day we arrived they said there had been a mistake and the hotel was over booked. Not to worry, they would have us stay in their sister hotel for the first night. The staff at that hotel was friendly but it was of much less quality and we had to move our luggage in the morning. They also charge us the same rate to stay at a smokey hotel as the 4 star we booked The next day when we got back to the Antis they stated we were booked for three nights and not the six reserved. Although, the first day they did book us a car back to the airport at the end of the six night stay, We showed them them the email confirming six nights and it made no difference. However, I am sure if we had canceled they would still have charged us under the cancellation policy. The next battle was over the room rate. The confirmation email stated it was 90 Euro and they wanted to charge us 110 Euro. They feel like once you are here you are stuck with their terms. One afternoon we got back to the room and they had ripped part of the bath ceiling out with no explanation. Do not expect to sleep with the train rattling by all night long. Do not get suckered into their tours. A major rip off...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.....”
Reviews.Author: Rafagonz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for around 4 nights. The location is very convenient in terms of the attractions available in Istanbul, the room was OK. breakfast OK too. Beware however that the train passes quite close to the hotel and you may feel/hear it. I got used to it after one night, but I am a heavy sleeper. Service was not the best (except for the night receptionist who was very nice). The rate was OK also and I made good use of the free WI-FI.

Reviews.Title: “Just do not go to this hotel ! It was horrible !”
Reviews.Author: AudreyLiege188644
Reviews.Content: I really wondr if people giving this hotel a good rating are talking about the same hotel as the one I stayed at early October ... We thought that picking a 4 star hotel will guarantee some sort of quality ... we were so wrong. First of all the hotel is located 20 meters from a train line .... the train passes at least until midnight and starts in the morning at around 5 AM. And they are loud ! Even with earplugs I could hear and "feel" them as the windows and the floor moved a bit. Then, the staff is more than unfriendly, they are just full of themselves and impolite. When asked if the train was running all night long, they just laughed at us and said that maybe it is not running from 3 to 4 AM. When asked to change room, they told us they were fully booked. When we asked again the following morning, they changed us saying"ok, you have now "proved" that you didn't sleep well because of the noise of the train, so we can change your room". It didn't help as they put us in a room 3 meters further and the noise was as loud as in the first room. When asked to book a restaurant for us, they just replied "ppfffttss". It is only after 3 "ppfffttss" that they told us that this restaurant was not good (which we don't agree with as we tried it), that the restaurant paid the lonely planet to appear in it and they refused to call it to make a booking. They recommended another restaurant instead. When asked why Saint Sophia was closed on Mondays, whether it was a special day, they just said we should asked the government. I can go on and on ... trust me, just do not go ....

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: southamptonking
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our holiday. Staff were so nice and helpful, the food upstairs was excellent, the location great and the rooms good. Enjoyed Istanbul a lot and would say stay here if you are looking for a good hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “2-star service in a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: VMGSeoul
Reviews.Content: Directly beside train line, VERY noisy from 5:45am til midnight. Pushy front desk clerk kept trying to sell us a local tour. Our room (supposedly the best in the place) had water stains on the ceiling and peeling wallpaper. Pics on Web site are WAY nicer than in person. The bathroom had only a jacuzzi; quite challenging to shower standing up in a tub with no shower curtain. Barely adequate breakfast buffet (same stuff every day) including bad instant coffee from a machine. No room service. Rock hard bed. Safe in our room didn't work; we asked for it to be fixed but that was never done. Hotel's van had bald tires (guys had to push us out of the hotel alley because the tires kept slipping on the pavement). Then the transmission broke so they hailed a cab for us (but pocketed the extra $$ we'd paid for the hotel-arranged service). But it was clean and was close to the major attractions which worked in their favor. Just don't say you're a four-star hotel when, clearly, you aren't. No way I'd stay there again, when there are so many other places in Istanbul to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: ucap
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived we arrived the man at the desk was rude. We asked the man to ensure the room was nice to which he replied " What are you going to do if it is not?" as it was pre booked. The sea view room has no sea view-photos are very deceiving. It is on the top floor next to the restaurant with a tv on one of the side walls outside which you might as well have on inside. So difficult to sleep in. The room was very basic. Ideal for a backpacker with no money. But, we had paid alot of money to stay there. It is not 4 stars. More like 2 stars. I did not feel safe there. On our first night at 2330hrs the building next door started to do major construction work. We asked the desk to ask them to stop as we wanted to go to sleep. I was pregnant and not feeling well. They told us that they were NOT going to do anything about it. We were astounded. We have stayed at some really lovely places in the world and thought that they may take some pride in their guests and hotel. We ended up arguing with them and telling them that if they did nothing about it, we would call the police. They encouraged this. I am ashamed to say that it was ramadan and being a muslim myself, they hardly showed any compassion especially when we told them I was pregnant. We had booked with Hotels.com and called them up to explain the situation. They were fantastic and repaid our whole 5 night stay and appologised. The next day we checked out and checked into the Hilton was which fantastic. I would never stay or recommend this hotel to any one. Please stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “AntÄ±s hotel - great locatÄ±on and servÄ±ce”
Reviews.Author: Cintidoc
Reviews.Content: For most AmerÄ±cans travelÄ±ng to Ä°stanbul thÄ±s Ä±s a great hotel to stay at. Excellent servÄ±ce and meets every need based on our contÄ±nental hotel experÄ±ence. <<Recommend Ä±t hÄ±ghly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: monika070
Reviews.Content: Superb location and staff very friendly,helpful and imformative. Beautiful view of the blue mosque from the terrace and only a 5 minute walk to the main square and all best sites to visit. Rooms were clean and tidy and facilities within great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel wih friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Baneed18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Antis in June 2010 with my family on our first visit to Istanbul. The hotel was in a great location, not far from the famous blue mosque and with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. The staff were very friendly and accommodating but the guys on reception did a trying to sell us every tourist trip going but this is typical of Istanbul and Turkey in general. The rooms were spacious, with good ammenities, the only downside was that our room was right next to a train track which they don't tell you on the website. This wasn't so much of a problem as we weren't light sleepers but the sound of the trains going past was quite noticeable when you were awake. The breakfast wasn't great either and towards the end we ended up buying yoghurts and fruits from the nearby corner shop. All in all it was a pleasant stay and good value for money, however i wouldn't have classified the Antis as being a 4 star hotel. We would have said it was more of 3 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel but old-world courtesy”
Reviews.Author: nocarpetsthankyou
Reviews.Content: The Antis was all I could have hoped for. Though initially a little difficult to find (street signs seem to be largely absent in Istanbul!) it is within easy walking distance of many of the attractions in the old city as well as many places to eat. I did not book full meals but the breakfast was perfectly adequate. The staff were universally friendly and extremely generous with their time despite a heavy workload.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Shingles101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to both the Blue Mosque and St Sophia. It's virtually on top of a railway line but this didn't bother us at all (few trains seem to run, and are going slowly when they do). Breakfast was better than average - take your coffee up to the roof terrace to enjoy the morning view. Internet access easily achieved, staff friendly (and very keen on tripadvisor!) - what'e not to like? In fact the only negative was some pretty alarming decor.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: hollynewc1
Reviews.Content: On arrival to this hotel I was greeted by friendly staff and nice cup of Turkish tea. There had been a mix up with my booking and I had to stay in a nearby hotel for my first night, however I was offered a free meal for me and my friends for the inconvenience. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to the blue mosque (about 10 minutes walk). The staff were very friendly, helpful and happy to carry our breakfast up to the roof terrace every day! The room was spotlessly clean, good ac, the shower was powerful and the hot water didnâ€™t run out. One downside of the room was a lack of storage space for clothes. Although there is a train track right outside it never bothered us and it didnâ€™t keep us awake at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ShopnaBegum
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very grand and staff welcomed us with a nice cup of Turkish Tea. Our room was number 304, we had the train track in the back but that didn't really bother us at all as we were out and about most of the day, and knocked out in the night!!!! I have to say one of the reception staff was a bit moody but again we did not really care as everyone else was sooooooooooooo lovely and friendly even the ladies that cleaned our room! And they didn't complain at all considering the amount of mess me and my cousin made packing all our shopping in our suitcases! It was great they had Internet access, as I was able to email friends and family even when lying in bed via Wi Fi. Also in a great location from the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Hippodrome and Haiga Sophia all within walking distance. The sea and restaurants are also just around the corner so great for eating out. Nearby there are also loads of shops. Service from all the waiters was excellent, very well spoken and easy to get along with and very cute reception boy in the evenings!!!! The view from the terrace was absolutely divine especially at night!!!!!!!! Would definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rode reception treatment, bad smell from the ventilating system and the noise from the other rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Rokonela
Reviews.Content: Our firs impression was Terrible. The guy at the reception was rode and arrogant with us. He started joking about our reservation saying itâ€™s outrageous and the price itâ€™s a joke. Finally after dealing with such a person our problem was solved by the Booking.com customer service representative (who handled the problem very professionally). The reception guy didnâ€™t apologies for the mistake and the way he treated us was different from the way he treated other customers. He could hardly speak now while at firs he was making inappropriate jokes. He was very nervous now and impolite. Living this bad experience behind, the room are beautiful, clean and the facilities ok. Every thing itâ€™s just perfect, the room, the lobby and the restaurant. We had an amazing view, from our room we had the see view and the Blue Mosque view also(301 was our room). Amazing view and location. What we didnâ€™t like was: â€¢ The way we were treated at the reception. â€¢ The smell from the room (late in the evening and early in the morning an awful kitchen smell came and persisted for an hour or more). â€¢ The noise (not from outside but from the other rooms. We could hear perfectly other peopleâ€™s conversations, TV, and other sound from the hall). To better understand how we were treated at the reception I will try to reproduce exactly as it happened: We arrived at the location but since the streets are so tight in the old area of Istanbul, I got of the car and my boyfriend tried to find a place to park the car. I have entered the hotel and said: â€œI have a reservation on my name, CNâ€� The guy at the reception was looking thru the papers and said â€œFrom Bulgaria, no?â€�. Me:â€�No! From Romaniaâ€�. Him: â€œBulgaria, Romania same thingâ€�. Me: â€œNot exactly, but whatever. Can you tell me where can we park our car?â€� He gave me the directions and went with my boyfriend to park the car. We came back and waited for him to finish the customer in front of us. We gave him the booking.com reservation confirmation and started laughing and said that he doesnâ€™t have our reservation, and the price we booked itâ€™s outrageous. He: â€œDo you see this price, where have you found this price, with this money you canâ€™t buy a beer on this street.â€� Me: â€œYes I see the price, itâ€™s the price this hotel had for this night on the site we had the reservation done. Please check if I have a reservation on my name and then check the details about the price.â€� He: â€œThis price itâ€™s a joke. I donâ€™t have your reservation and there itâ€™s nothing form me to checkâ€� Me: â€œThe price itâ€™s not my problem, itâ€™s your mistake if itâ€™s not ok. Please talk to your boss to solve this problem.â€� He: â€œI donâ€™t have time to give you explanations, I have customers to take care of.â€� And then he ignored us and treated other customersâ€�. Meanwhile I have called the customer service number from the site I have made my reservation. I friendly girl answered me and listened me all the way about my problem. Let me tell you that I have made this reservation 5 months before, so if there was a problem with the price or the reservation they had all the time in the world to let me know and correct the mistake. The girl called at the reception and talked with the guy (the rode one). After talking with her he has changed itâ€™s argument. There wasnâ€™t a money problem anymore, he said the hotel itâ€™s fully booked. After another conversation with the girl form out booking site he said he can offer us a room at another hotel nearby. We said ok, if itâ€™s the same price and the same conditions that we were expecting. He asked another guy to take us there, we saw the Hotel, it was ok for us and checked in. We went out in the city since it was our last day in Istanbul and we had already lost a loot of time. In the afternoon when we came to the Hotel offered to us as an alternative, the guy at the reception apologized and said that the Antis Hotel has a free room and we have to go there. He apologized again and offered to help us moving our luggage from a place to another. We arrived at Antis again: Me: â€œSo, where are you sending us this time?â€� He: â€œNowhere, I have a free roomâ€� Me: â€œBut a couple of hours ago it was all booked. What happened? He: mourned something that I couldnâ€™t understand and said â€œIâ€™ll give you your room cardâ€� Gave us the card and that was the last thing we have spoke with him. I have left my feedback at the reception. I would recommend this hotel because it was very beautiful despite the treatment we received (the treatment itâ€™s something that can be changed). If the manager would fix the ventilating system and take some actions to correct or train the reception staff behavior and customer service skills it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “excellent view and hospitality .”
Reviews.Author: aydinsnmez
Reviews.Content: the staff wasreally helpful and try to make you happy about your stay.i stayed in the suite at the last floor with a amazing seaview.the room was very clean and nice furnished with a jacuzi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant and defÄ±natly recomended”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed82
Reviews.Content: ThÄ±s hotel Ä±s sÄ±tuated close to the blue mosque, the staff are very freÄ±ndly and gave excellant advÄ±ce, the consÄ±erge was excellant who made our holÄ±day to Turkey an enjoyable and pleasent trÄ±p as he was always helpful poÄ±ntÄ±ng out all the local attactÄ±ons to us. After readÄ±ng prevÄ±ous negatÄ±ve revÄ±ews, Ä± can assure anyone that thÄ±s hotel Ä±s well recomended, Ä± have travelled all over the world and the servÄ±ce recÄ±eved at AntÄ±s was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “so rude”
Reviews.Author: madina18
Reviews.Content: this hotel could be consÄ±dered as the worst ever hotel known to man the staff here are Ä±ncredÄ±bly rude and often show great amouts of both verbal abuse and physÄ±cal abuse. they are hÄ±ghly arragant ans show very lÄ±ttle respect to theÄ±r guest Ä± would strong recoment not to stay here and they would ruÄ±n your holÄ±day to turkey

Reviews.Title: “dishonest, unfriendly, dirty”
Reviews.Author: c-ntrip
Reviews.Content: Ok, the location is great; however "concierge is rude, unfriendly, not helpful, and is a dishonest crook. Due to an airstrike, we lost a night's stay. He did not try to offer an amenities, and dishonored our airport transportation voucher, which was part of the contract. When he did arrange transportation, he did the lira/euro trick. He told us the price for transport in liras and then when the transport arrived, said it was euros (which is twice the rate.) Our room's rug was filthy and expedia advertised that we would receive a room with a view of the Sea of Mamar. When we asked to change, he "offered" us a dirtier and smaller room. Istanbul has many hotels. If you want to be had by a dishonest, unfriendly, and arrogant conceirge with less that 2 star amenities, then by all means stay at the Antis. Also, the command of English is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Antis hotel - I will come back again”
Reviews.Author: TeodoraPeeva
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Istanbul. I do recommend when you go there to stay at Antis hotel! Perfect location for sightseeing, new and stylish furniture. I stayed at room 208 - it really wasn't noisy, especially when you close the window you can not hear anything coming from outside. The staff is very kind and hard working. Especially Okan, Senol, Ercan - thank you for all advices that you gave me and for making my fist visit in Instanbul unforgetable!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern Rooms in the heart of Sultanmet”
Reviews.Author: Fairouzeh
Reviews.Content: I chose this place because of the reviews on here and I was really pleased to find they were right! The room was great value, booked with my flight. It felt pretty luxurious and the mattress was amazing. Next time I go there for business I'll probably stay in a different area, but I would definitely recommend this place for tourists wanting to stay close to the major sights but away from the noisy tourist centre. The only slight downside was the room was to the front overlooking the nice quiet road but too close to the railway line. It wasn't that noticeable really I guess. Just a minor issue really.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a great central location for access to all of the sites”
Reviews.Author: maxidog1
Reviews.Content: We boked the Antis through the internet based on reviews and price (it was discounted by 30% compared to equivalent hotels). What we got was a hotel that was in a really great central location with service that could not have been bettered in a 5 star hotel. Location - the Antis is in a small community in Sultanahmet of boutique hotels and local shops all tastefully maintained and it is in very short walking distance from the Blue Mosque. There are Bosphorus sea views from the upper floors. Whilst a local railway line runs next door, the trains are infrequent and relatively quiet. The location is probably the best in central Istanbul. Service - the staff are really friendly and very helpful. One of them even guided me to show me the whereabouts of local ATM when I needed some money. Breakfasts were good and the rooftop restaurant had a great view of the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dithy007
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of Sultanahment, close to everything you'd want to see: Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and loads more. Everything was within walking distance, as was the tram stop (and bus stop and station.) Unlike some people, we had no trouble at all finding the hotel, and did it all on public transport from Sabiha Gokcen Airport on the Asian side (but I did do my homework beforehand and had worked out the route).
