All the staff were really helpful, the breakfast was what you'd expect from a hotel that has to cater for people from all over the world: a selection of meat, cheeses, fruit, lovely fresh bread, vegetables, eggs, cakes...... And you could take it all up onto the roof terrace with views of the Bosphorus (or the Sea of Marmara - not sure) and the Blue Mosque. Also had an evening meal up there one night, which was great, too. Yes, the railway and the mosque were right next door, but it REALLY wasn't a problem. With the window shut (and the air conditioning on) it wasn't too loud at all, and the trains didn't run between about midnight and 6am anyway. The room was nice with a sea view; the bathroom (with a shower) was a bit small, but OK, with a multi- headed shower, nice and powerful and a combined toilet and bidet. Clean towels every day. Really couldn't want more from a hotel for this type of holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Manu1861
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a convenient location, near Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The hotel provided a free pick-up service from the airport (while the transfer back cost 25 euros for 2 people) and the welcoming when we arrived was great. However, we spent the first night at their nearby hotel, Almina, as something in our room needed fixing. That was a bit of a nuisance, but the staff were nice and offered a complimentary bottle of wine and a basket of fruit to make up. The room we were then given was very nice and clean, breakfast could have been larger but all in all it was satisfactory. The train passed just in front of our window but we slept well, maybe because when we came back we were always very tired! I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul which, by the way, is a fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “great location, lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LondonAllie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May and were very pleased with the hotel. The location is excellent, only a short stroll from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi and the Cistern. There is a tram stop near the mosque which will take you to the spice bazaar, grand bazaar and over the water. So perfect location. There is also a roof terrace with great views of the Mosque one one side and the bospherous on the other. On the streets near the hotel there are some lovely restaurants and recommend trying these - it has a real resort feel about it (rather than inner city). The rooms are decorated in a very sumptious fashion and are comfortable. The only disappointment here was that there was a single wardrobe with a few hangers and there were no drawers anywhere. As a result we lived out of a suitcase - not ideal. Breakfast was average - whilst i will always eat the local specialities for lunch and dinner, i'm quite traditional at breakfast and like cereal, fruit, bread and the occasional fry up. The bread was amazing - so fresh, and there was a good selection of meats and cheeses, but limited fruit, juices, cereal and hot food. Service at breakfast was a little bit slow (getting tables cleared, replenishing buffet etc). Service on the whole was very good - receptionist friendly and informative, and staff taking bags to room, serving drinks etc also very friendly. Other guests have mentioned the noise from the train - our room was quite close to the train line and whilst you can hear it it didnt keep us awake as the double glazing is very effective. One other note of caution, they were in the final stages of building small bar/nightclub opposite the hotel as we were leaving. I imagine that with the nightclub sound proofing and the good double glazing that this shouldnt cause too many problems but keep in mind if you are a light sleeper. We had a wonderful time and the location is spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully located and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter54
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located between the blue mosque and the hagia sophia to provide beautiful views and easy access to all the sights. The people were very friendly and accommodating. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Convient location”
Reviews.Author: aardbei
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as part of an holiday package. It was the location that compelled us; walking distance from all sights. The roof terrace is great, good views over the Bosporus and Blue Mosque. Staff is friendly and helpful, if you can handle the cheeky attitude of some... Breakfast was a bit disappointing. Like many hotels they offer a lot of the worst. Why not just keep it simple. Just a fresh croissant, juice and good coffee will do for most. The rooms are spotless and fitted with all mod cons. Having free working wifi is definitely a plus. The beds are a bit hard, but not too uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer focused hotel in fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brit1179
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a three night stay at the Antis Hotel I feel compelled to write my first ever hotel review. This was the first time that I had ever booked a hotel directly with the hotel via emails and I had prepared myself to be disappointed but this was certainly not the case. After a bit of initial trouble in locating the hotel (the driver spent ages just driving up and down the side streets in sultanahmet even though I kept trying to point out that the hotel's phone number was on my email confirmation!) which was due to the hotel being so new that not all the regular shuttle/taxi drivers had heard of it, we were pleasantely greeted by staff who made checking in a smooth process. We were even welcomed with turkish tea. We changed rooms after one night as we wanted a double room rather than the twin room that we had been given and staff helped us move our belongings from one room to another. Room 107 is by a train track but this never bothered us as it seemed to be used infrequently. The decor was ottaman influenced but modern and airy. The rooms were very clean, with powerful air con and mini bars that we used to store our own drinks in (the chambermaids didn't seem to object to this). The rooms were smaller than they looked on the website but we weren't in the room that much anyway. Breakfast was okay, I didn't really take to the turkish style of breakfast so it would not be a fair critique if I commented on it but my only comment would be that the 'fuit ' juice could have been chilled and perhaps some crossaints/pastries also available for those who didn't want to eat traditional turkish food for breakfast. Staff were friendly and extremely helpful, they are definetely the all important ingredient to this hotel and I would recommend a stay here to anyone. the location is fantastic, close to all the major sights and has a small corner shop just around the corner. The free wifi was great, and for those who didn't have laptops/phones there was a computer set up in a discreet corner in the lobby where people could access the internet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with a truly Family friendly Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Saleh09
Reviews.Content: From the moment of your arrival to the time for departure we were made to feel part of the Antis Family; all this was orchestrated by the 3 guys at Reception, Orken, Gorken & Ercan. The guys at breakfast were just as accommodating. The positioning of the Hotel was ideal to visit the main attractions by foot; even the sea was a 5 min walk in the opposite direction. The nearest Tram stop is also not far, again walking distance away. All this will be explained on your arrival by one of the boys at reception (they even sorted out our airport transfers). Yes the railway line is close, but you get over that within hours. The rooms were clean, and the showers were powerful with an excellent view from the roof terrace (a bit too cold for breakfast in early April, but stunning views). A Street full of restaurants is only 3 min walk from the hotel. The streets outside are cobbled stoned on an incline, as are many of the inside streets around Istanbul so appropriate footwear will be required (you can put away your dancing shoes). For our family this was the ideal Hotel in the ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Check in as a Guest.. and check out as Family. Perfect hotel for all.”
Reviews.Author: Zainab87
Reviews.Content: The Antis hotel in Istanbul is sensation able. It is in perfect locationâ€¦. Itâ€™s within a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Haj Sofia, Grand Bazaar, trams, Trans, restraints and buses. The Antis hotel is extremely clean. The one thing that struck me most about this hotel was its unforgettable customer service. You truly check in as a guest and check out as family. I would like to say a huge thank you to all of the staff at the Antis hotel and extend a special thank you to a particular staff member named Ercan know as Gavin. We were greeted by Gavin upon check in who provided us with knowledgeable information about Istanbul and Turkey itself. Gavin was able to answer all questions and assisted us with any problems that came our ways. He also referred us to a fantastic travel agent and gave me tips on what we should and should not do. Gavin goes way and beyond for his entire guest. I have almost travelled around the world and stayed at many hotels and never experienced such great service. Thank you Gavin for making my journey and experience in Turkey an unforgettable. I strongly and only recommend staying at the Antis hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: saariii
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. clean, friendly people and a fantastic view: the blue mosk and the sea!! We had a great time. My grandfather is disabled and they did every thing they could to help him!! Thank you very much Antis Hotel!! Family Tulp-Schilder

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jansotir
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel in lovely neighbourhood of Sultanahmet. Very close to Blue Mosque, Agia Sofia and Grand Bazaar, plus tram stop nearby which takes you over the Galatas Bridge. Lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. Room was average size, beds comfortable, bathroom very clean with lots of hot water and strong water pressure in shower. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast average. Minor problem with train noise - they stop from midnight til 6 am. Prayer call at 6 am rather loud, but this will happen wherever you stay, as mosques are on every corner in Istanbul, with loudspeakers on every minaret!! On the whole, a very pleasant stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Cather7
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is situated in the Old Town, where it is quieter at night. The hotel is located right next to the train track so it can be loud when a train goes by. We asked for a room on the opposite site of the train track and it was fine. The breakfast is included. The location is great. The staff was very helpful, the hotel and room very clean. Note : The water is not good to drink in Istanbul so you have to pay for the water at the hotel but there is a corner store 20 seconds from the hotel where water is cheap.
